page.title: 06ERSKINE HOSPITAL
page.content: The{Princess Louise Scottish {Hospital}at Erskine was founded in 1916 to{treat, rehabilitate and care for the flood of{disabled} {ex-servicemen}returning from the First World War. The hospital today has{347}patients of whom{50}are women. Many served in the{Second World War}and other theatres of war since then, including the{Northern Ireland}conflict of recent years. Within the hospital estate are{50} {cottages}occupied by disabled men who are able to live with their families, and there is a{hostel}to accommodate men not in need of full hospital care. Employment{workshops}provided for the men include{printing,}a market garden,{cane furniture making,} {knitting}etc. and the goods are then sold in the{Crafts and Garden Centre.}
